step.reason: \text{If }t = x^2 + 4, \text{ then }dt = 2x.dx\\ \implies 3.dt = 6x.dx\\ \therefore \int \dfrac{6x}{x^2+4}.dx = \underbrace{3}_{M}\int \dfrac{dt}{t}\\ \text{Also, }t = 4 \left(x =0\right)\text{ and }t = 8 \left(x = 2\right)\\ \text{So. }\int_{0}^{2}\dfrac{6x}{x^2+4}.dx = 3\int_{4}^{8}\dfrac{dt}{t}\\ \implies M= 3, m=4\text{ and }n=8\\
